answers.answer: Recommend consuming Omegas 3 / 6 from food sources and not supplementations. The best source is fish especially mackerel, tuna, salmon, and lake trout. Fish should be eaten 2 times a week. Omega 3 is found in whole nuts, soy nuts / oil, and canola oil. Recommend 1-2 teaspoons of nuts daily. If you still prefer supplementation, then use children dose.

question: My 11 year old was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes almost 2 years ago.  Her cholesterol is slightly elevated and we were told to consider starting her on omega 3 supplements.  I didnt think to ask at the time, but because my daughter is the size of an adult, should I give her an adults dose or a childs dose?
title: Omega 3 supplement for diabetic child
